intro: Piriqueta leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered piriqueta, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
